channel.title: Process on oscardelahoya.net
channel.description: Recent content in Process on oscardelahoya.net

item.title: Hunter Gatherer Mode
item.description: I’ve been enjoying photography this year — or, more accurately, professional anxiety spun the big wheel of interests in my head, and landed with full force on photography. Picture making has been a treat, to be sure, but I’m very much addicted to reading, comparing, learning, buying (gulp), and all of the activities around photography. The research of the craft, one can say. Even so, I have been taking photos.

item.title: Singles Hitter
item.description: Ichiro Suzuki recorded 4,367 hits over a 28-year career split between Japan and the United States. If you consider both hemispheres of his career together, Ichiro had more hits than anyone else in history (Pete Rose slapped, clawed, and hustled his way to 4,256 hits between 1963 and 1986). Only 235 of these were home runs. It’s an appropriate time to set intentions, not only because it’s the first day of 2025, but because in about a week, I’ll drive to Savannah to install a solo show—“You’re the Man Now Dog”, natch.
